snippet: Ding Yuxin was fined 2.5 billion renminbi, or about $408 million, for paying bribes and conducting illegal business.
abstract: Chinese court sentences Ding Yuxin to 20 years in prison and orders her to pay largest fine yet amid Pres Xi Jinping's anticorruption campaign; Ding, prominent businesswoman, was convicted of bribery linked to country's disgraced former railroads minister.
lead_paragraph: Ding Yuxin was fined 2.5 billion renminbi, or about $408 million, for paying bribes and conducting illegal business.

headline.main: Chinese Businesswoman Convicted of Bribery Is Sentenced to 20 Years
headline.print_headline: China: Woman Convicted of Graft Gets 20-Year Sentence and $408 Million Fine
